title: Cori /Theta hangs with setup-env.sh sourced in bashrc
body:
Cori hangs whenver setup-env.sh is sourced inside of my bashrc. 
The command `. $SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/setup-env.sh` happens to work fine whenever I manually input them. 

Here's the output when I source bashrc.ext with set -x placed in the setup-env.sh file.

```
_sp_share_dir=$(cd "$(dirname $_sp_source_file)" && pwd)
cd "$(dirname $_sp_source_file)" && pwd)
cd "$(dirname $_sp_source_file)" && pwd
dirname $_sp_source_file)"
dirname $_sp_source_file)
dirname $_sp_source_file
_sp_prefix=$(cd "$(dirname $(dirname $_sp_share_dir))" && pwd)
cd "$(dirname $(dirname $_sp_share_dir))" && pwd)
cd "$(dirname $(dirname $_sp_share_dir))" && pwd
dirname $(dirname $_sp_share_dir))"
dirname $(dirname $_sp_share_dir))
dirname $(dirname $_sp_share_dir)
dirname $_sp_share_dir)
dirname $_sp_share_dir
_spack_pathadd PATH       "${_sp_prefix%/}/bin"
_pa_oldvalue=${PATH:-}
_sp_sys_type=$(spack-python -c 'print(spack.architecture.sys_type())')
spack-python -c 'print(spack.architecture.sys_type())')
spack-python -c 'print(spack.architecture.sys_type())'
```
After that it hangs.

Whenever I try to run any spack command, it hangs and I Ctrl-C out of it. Here's the stack trace:

Out of ideas on what it could be. It looks like _default_target_from_env is not responding but it works when I don't have spack's shell support activated! Thanks for the help!
